data.chText: 刑事罪、重罪、轻罪、性犯罪等

data.enText: a first offence (= the first time that sb has been found guilty of a crime)
a capital offence (= one for which sb may be punished by death)

data.chText: 他没有意识到自己犯罪了。
data.enText: He was not aware that he had committed an offence .

data.chText: 妨害社会 / 人类 / 国家的罪行
新法律规定持枪为犯罪行为。
data.enText: New legislation makes it an offence to carry guns.
the act of upsetting or insulting sb

data.chText: 我相信他那么说并无冒犯的意思。
data.enText: I'm sure he meant no offence when he said that.

data.chText: 这张照片可能会引起一些人的反感。
data.enText: The photo may cause offence to some people.

data.chText: 你若早退谁也不会介意的。
data.enText: No one will take offence (= feel upset or insulted) if you leave early.
Don't be so quick to take offence .
used to say that you do not mean to upset or insult sb by sth you say or do

data.chText: 我无意冒犯，但我确实想自己一个人。
data.enText: No offence, but I'd really like to be on my own.
used to say that you do not mean to upset or insult sb by sth you say or do

data.chText: 我无意冒犯，但我确实想自己一个人。
data.enText: No offence, but I'd really like to be on my own.

tr: (criminal law) an act punishable by law
the action of attacking an enemy
a failure to show regard for others
a feeling of anger caused by being offended
example: he took offence at my question

tr: the team that has the ball (or puck) and is trying to score

value.boxr_value: The spelling offense is used in American English. The pronunciation /'ɒfens/ is used for meaning 3. 拼写offense用于美国英语中。义项3读作/'ɒfens/。

value.def: An offence is a crime that breaks a particular law and requires a particular punishment.

example.ex: Thirteen people have been charged with treason — an offence which can carry the death penalty...
example.tran: 13人被控犯有叛国罪——一种可处死刑的罪行。

example.ex: In Britain the Consumer Protection Act makes it a criminal offence to sell goods that are unsafe.
example.tran: 英国的《消费者保护法》规定销售不安全物品属刑事犯罪行为。

value.def: Offence or an offence is behaviour which causes people to be upset or embarrassed.

example.ex: The book might be published without creating offense...
example.tran: 出版这本书可能不会引起人们的反感。

example.ex: Privilege determined by birth is an offence to any modern sense of justice.
example.tran: 与生俱来的特权是对现代公正意识的亵渎。

value.def: In sports such as American football or basketball, the offense is the team which has possession of the ball and is trying to score.

example.ex: Between plays the coach was talking to the offense in the huddle.
example.tran: 中场时，这位教练对围拢一圈的进攻队员进行战术指导。

value.tran: （体育运动中的）进攻队，进攻方

value.def: If you cause offence or give offence to someone, you say or do something rude which upsets or embarrasses them.

example.ex: It says the photograph is likely cause distress and offence to the public...
example.tran: 上面说这张照片可能引起公众的忧虑和反感。

example.ex: We have had our differences and I'm sorry if it has caused offence.
example.tran: 我们有过一些分歧，如有得罪我很抱歉。

value.def: Some people say 'no offence' to make it clear that they do not want to upset you, although what they are saying may seem rather rude.

example.ex: Dad, you need a bath. No offence.
example.tran: 爸爸，别见怪，不过你该洗澡了。

value.def: If someone takes offence at something you say or do, they feel upset, often unnecessarily, because they think you are being rude to them.

example.ex: She never takes offence at anything...
example.tran: 什么事都不会让她生气。

example.ex: Never had she seen him so tense, so quick to take offence as he had been in recent weeks.
example.tran: 她从未见过他像最近几周这样高度紧张，动不动就生气。

value.tran: （常指不必要地）(对…)生气，(因…)见怪
